1.content:
It was just another boring weekend for Steve. And it would probably be a boring week, and it would culminate in a boring summer. There was going to be absolutely nothing to do.

Steve hadn't planned to spend this summer being bored. He had just graduated high school and had no responsibilities until the fall, when college started. His parents were leaving on a month long vacation to Europe, and he would have the house all to himself. Not that Steve planned to have wild parties. He was a little nerdy...well, a lot nerdy to get included in the party circuit crowd. But he did have his own crowd. And his crowd was planning on spending a month gaming at every hour of the day, interspersed with binge television.

Except all of Steve's buddies had to bail on him. Even his best friend Stan was going to be gone all month.

So Steve was going to be by himself housesitting until his parents came home.

Fun.

Steve was starting day two of his house sentence when he got a package in the mail. It was an odd package that looked like it had come from the other side of the world, and had taken the roughest route to get to his house.

That observation wasn't far from the truth. When Steve opened up the package, it contained a television remote and a handwritten note from his granduncle Jefferson. The remote control looked like it was an antique, something you would see in a museum display on the golden age of television. The note was hand scribbled by his uncle, and it was barely legible.

Steve could read every other word in the note, but he realized he must be missing something. According to his uncle, the remote was an artifact, or had been magically imbued, or something. But supposedly it had the ability to extract a woman from a television screen and plant her right in front of you, shrunk to six inches.

An artifact television remote control? That sounded like something from Warehouse 13!

Steve decided that either his granduncle had gone off his rocker, or Steve wasn't reading the note right. But shows like Warehouse 13 were works of fiction. Devices didn't exist in the real world that would do what his granduncle said this remote did. I mean, shrunken women? There were all sorts of laws of physics and biology that made the idea of a shrunken woman impossible!

Steve tossed the note aside and went to get something to eat.

And as he ate, Steve thought about some actresses that he would love to see at six inches tall. I mean, he could have a lot of fun with a woman that small. And, except for the internet, female anatomy was still a mystery to Steve. He could find out a lot of things from a six inch woman that he couldn't find out in real life. Because a six inch woman would have to be more cooperative.

Not that he would hurt anyone, no matter what her size, Steve told himself. He'd be real gentle.

Steve shook his head. He needed to get that idea out of his head. You couldn't shrink a woman down to six inches. It was impossible!

Steve went back to the family room and turned on the television. He started scrolling through the menu, seeing if there was anything that would keep his attention.

Steve saw the 'artifact' remote control lying where he left it. He ignored it, and continued scrolling down the menu of channels.

After a few minutes, Steve swore and grabbed the artifact remote. He told himself he was going to use it just once so that he could get the shrinking fantasy out of his head. With that in mind, Steve started looking for a show or musical video to extract a shrunken woman from.

Which category of women does Steve select his shrunken woman from?

The artifact remote was just like any other tool. Well perhaps not "just like." But it was a tool. It was designed to operate within certain parameters, and to produce certain results within those parameters. And, like most tools, the individual(s) who crafted assumed the user would know how to use it within those limits.

In this case, Steve knew that if he pointed and clicked the remote at the right time, it would theoretically give the desired results, i.e., a hot young woman shrunk down to six inches for him to play with. He didn't actually believe it would happen, but that's what he was hoping for.

Unfortunately (or perhaps fortunately) for Steve, the artifact was designed to shrink one chosen woman at a time. It could shrink multiple women, but it was meant to do so consecutively, not concurrently. When Steve tried shrink two women at once, it overloaded the remote.

So the remote drew energy and information from both Steve and the internet. The information was accidental. It had all the information it thought it needed. Steve wanted Chasty and Elisha, and the remote was trying to provide that duo.

But when it tapped into the internet, it got confused, and tried to find someone to "team up" Chasty with. It saw that Chasty had guest starred in an episode of Smallville with Erica Durance, and so decided to team Chasty up with Erica.

When it tapped into Steve, it saw that the eighteen year old virgin had only the vaguest knowledge of how women's clothing could "accentuate" the figure, and so Steve often confused the "accentuation" with reality. So Steve often fantasized about a hyper-idealized form of a woman, and not the woman herself.

The end result was that two six inch women appeared before him, both in white bikinis, and both once again in their mid- to late twenties. Both had long hair, reaching down to the middle of their back, which Erica didn't have at that time in her life.

And then there were their breasts.

11212.content:
Steve's eyes bugged out as a bikini clad April Bowlby appeared before him.

Steve hadn't thought about what April Bowlby's reaction was going to be when she popped up before him. Part of that was intentional. Until it happened, Steve didn't think it was actually going to happen. Plus, Steve didn't allow himself to think about what he was going to do, because if he did, he'd realize that he was basically kidnapping an unwilling person and potentially altering their physical form for life. And if he thought about it too much, his conscience wouldn't have let him even go through the motions of potentially abducting and shrinking someone, no matter how unlikely that would be.

So Steve hadn't thought about what April Bowlby's reaction was going to be. But it sure wasn't what she did as soon as she looked up at him.

"Whoa, you're a giant," she said, eyes wide but obviously not frightened. "I guess that means I'm in the land of the giants now."

"Uh, yes," Steve said with uncertainty.

"Sweet," April said, looking around. "You know, this looks nothing like what the land of the giants looks like in BFG." April looks back at Steve, her eyebrows furrowed. "You're a big friendly giant, aren't you? Not one of those giants that eat people?"

Steve nods emphatically. "Very friendly. And I don't eat people."

April beams. "That's good. You know, when we watched BFG, Jake and Allan said it was special effects, but I didn't think so. I mean, it would take a ton of people to make up a giant costume, and they couldn't be that coordinated. So I bet they just took regular giants and put them in make up for the movie. I can't wait to see the looks on those guys' faces when they find out they're wrong!"

As Steve listen to April's voice, and the way she says things and the expression on her face, a thought begins growing in his mind. It doesn't seem possible, but then again, having a six inch bikini clad April Bowlby standing in front of him on top of a coffee table didn't seem possible just a few minutes ago either.

"I'm sorry," Steve begins, "But I didn't get your name."

"Oh, I'm Kandi," she responds, extending her hand. "Nice to meet you."

"I'm Steve," Steve responds, extending a single finger. When Kandi touches Steve's fingertip, she makes a little "Oh!" sound.

"Did I hurt you?" Steve asks, withdrawing his finger quickly.

"Oh no," Kandi replies. "Just touching you felt kind of nice. But it surprised me."

As Kandi looks around again, Steve realizes that's not a shrunken April Bowlby in front of him. It's a shrunken Kandi. A character from a television show, and not the actress who plays her. So Kandi had come from a world where the characters from Two and a Half Men were real. info.brief_description: Because there just aren't enough interactives about shrinking women! LOL!
info.description:
So what's the difference between this interactive and the interactives on the same subject? Well, this one is mine, of course. It's primarily here for me to write on, when I feel the urge to write. But others are invited to join, just as long as you follow the following rules.

1) Only women may be shrunk, and they may only be shrunk to six inches. Shrinking and un-shrinking are instantaneous
2) No vore, insertion, crushing, killing, pain or bathroom stuff
3) Everyone over eighteen, please
4) Keep sexual interaction between women to ladies of the same size, i.e., normal size to normal size, or shrunk to shrunk
5) You can bring celebrities in either as themselves, or as characters they've played
6) Try to keep your additions consistent with previous postings
7) If you'd like to see a certain storyline develop, but don't want to write it, feel free to drop me a line, and I can add your idea
8) Do not add Choice of Woman chapters. I have seen too many interactive where you have twenty-plus chapters that are basically "How about this woman? Yes or No?"All the choices are in the first two chapters. If you want to add another woman in subsequent chapters, that's fine, but no "Which woman do you choose" chapters
9) I reserve the right to edit or delete
10) Have fun
